Having had the endorsement of 130 crore citizens, the Citizenship Bill is passed in Lok Sabha. This bill gives citizenship to refugees who have had centuries of cultural affinity with Indian ethos. #IndiaSupportsCAApic.twitter.com/cZXH6Ts9FV
The Citizenship Amendment Bill 2019 gives citizenship to refugees who have had centuries of cultural affinity with Indian ethos. #IndiaSupportsCAApic.twitter.com/9XNMmqM9CU

As peaceful co-existence with radical Islam was impossible, non-Muslims of  Afghan, Pak etc fled to nations like India. 14,500 Afghan refugees are registered with UNHCR in India as of July 2018, including Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, Baha’is & Christians.
#IndiaSupportsCAA

Few months back, i met Hindu Refugees from Pakistan near Signature bridge, Delhi.

They were suffering for no fault of theirs. They have no place to go except India.

By providing them Indian citizenship, PM @narendramodi JI has given a sense of renewed hope.

CAA is about giving citizenship to persecuted refugees and not about taking anyone’s citizenship away. India supports this historic legislation.
